rows.text_1_facilitator: Learning how to solve problems with your child is important. üîÑ Let‚Äôs explore how today!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Learning how to solve problems with your child is important. üîÑ Let‚Äôs explore how today!

text_2.eng:
‚ùó Learning how to solve problems with your child can help you avoid having to use consequences. 

üå± As children get older, they will be able to work through their problems by themselves more often. 

üí° This builds important skills that will benefit them for life! üòÉ

rows.text_1_facilitator: @data.characters.f3_son_7.name‚Äôs mother, @data.characters.f3_mother.name is concerned that @data.characters.f3_son_7.name is sleeping late everyday because of unfinished homework. Let‚Äôs see how they try to solve the problem together:

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_7.name‚Äôs mother, @data.characters.f3_mother.name is concerned that @data.characters.f3_son_7.name is sleeping late everyday because of unfinished homework. Let‚Äôs see how they try to solve the problem together:

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name: Come on, @data.characters.f3_son_7.name, it's time to get ready for bed.

character_2_text.eng: But I still have so much homework to do!

character_3_text.eng: Hm, this is the third night in a row that you haven't got to bed on time because of homework.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_mother.name: Come on, @data.characters.f3_son_7.name, it's time to get ready for bed.
rows.character_2_text: But I still have so much homework to do!
rows.character_3_text: Hm, this is the third night in a row that you haven't got to bed on time because of homework.

rows.character_1_text: How can we make sure you get all your work done and still get to bed on time?

character_1_text.eng: How can we make sure you get all your work done and still get to bed on time?

character_3_text.eng: How about we make a rule that you start your homework half an hour after you get home from school. That way, you can finish it and have some time to relax before bed, too! I am happy to help you a little bit.

rows.character_3_text: How about we make a rule that you start your homework half an hour after you get home from school. That way, you can finish it and have some time to relax before bed, too! I am happy to help you a little bit.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_son_7.name, have you started your homework yet?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_7.name, have you started your homework yet?

character_2_text.eng: I'll start now, Mummy! Can I talk to you about this question?

rows.character_2_text: I'll start now, Mummy! Can I talk to you about this question?

rows.character_3_id: Well done, @data.characters.f3_son_7.name. Thank you for working with me to find a solution that works. Now you can be well-rested for tomorrow!
rows.character_1_text: Look, Mummy, I'm ready for bed so early tonight!

character_1_text.eng: Look, Mummy, I'm ready for bed so early tonight!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When something happens, take a deep breath. 

4Ô∏è‚É£ Then, help your child work on the problem with these four steps:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When something happens, take a deep breath. 

4Ô∏è‚É£ Then, help your child work on the problem with these four steps:

section_1_text.eng:
üí° Put the problem into words.
üëÇ Talk to your child about what the problem is.

section_2_text.eng:
üìù Together, think of possible solutions to this problem.
‚ú® What could you or your child do differently in this situation in the future?

section_3_text.eng:
‚≠ê Choose one solution together.
üîë Try it next time you are in a similar situation.

section_4_text.eng:
‚úÖ Ask yourself, ‚ÄúDid it work?‚Äù 
üòÉ If yes, great!
üòî If not, talk to your child about trying another solution next time.

rows.quiz_1_question: Are you ready for a home activity? ‚≠ê Today, talk with your child about the four steps to problem solving: Know It, Solve It, Try It, Test It. Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives! Can you do it today?

quiz_1_question.eng: Are you ready for a home activity? ‚≠ê Today, talk with your child about the four steps to problem solving: Know It, Solve It, Try It, Test It. Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives! Can you do it today?

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That‚Äôs okay. Try to review these steps together sometime this week.
